chat.content:
I will give you a Coq proof state, including both hypotheses and a specific goal and your need to prove it. Your response should be a singular code block of Coq proof starting with "```coq
", ending with "Qed.```", without any additional explanation or commentary. Follow to these guidelines:
Introduce variables using unique names to avoid any conflicts.
Keep each command distinct and separated, avoid concatenations like ';' or '[cmd|cmd]'.
Organize your proof with bullets like '-', '+', and '*' instead of braces ({, }). Shift to their double symbols like '--' and '++', when necessary.
Effectively use given premises, follow the syntax and structure demonstrated in the examples provided.

Example 1:

Hypotheses:
n, m: nat
IHn: m + n = n + m

Goal:
m + S n = S n + m

Proof:
```coq
simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Example 2:
Hypotheses:

Goal:
forall n m : nat, m + n = n + m

```coq
intros n m. induction n.
- simpl. auto.
- simpl. rewrite <- IHn. auto.
Qed.```

Solve This Proof State:

Hypotheses:
y: nat
x: nat
j: nat
i: nat
p: nat

Goal:
p <> 0 -> ~ divides p x -> ~ divides p y -> Nat.pow p i * x = Nat.pow p j * y -> i = j /\ x = y

Premises:
BinNat.N.pow = fun n p : BinNums.N => match p with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.Npos BinNums.xH | BinNums.Npos p0 => match n with | BinNums.N0 => BinNums.N0 | BinNums.Npos q => BinNums.Npos (BinPos.Pos.pow q p0) end end : BinNums.N -> BinNums.N -> BinNums.N Arguments BinNat.N.pow (_ _)%N_scope
divides = fun n k : nat => exists p : nat, k = p * n : nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments divides (_ _)%nat_scope
Module Nat := Struct Definition t : Set. Definition zero : nat. Definition one : nat. Definition two : nat. Definition succ : nat -> nat. Definition pred : nat -> nat. Definition add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition double : nat -> nat. Definition mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition sub : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition eqb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition leb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition ltb : nat -> nat -> bool. Definition compare : nat -> nat -> comparison. Definition max : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition min : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition even : nat -> bool. Definition odd : nat -> bool. Definition pow : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_add : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_addmul : nat -> nat -> nat -> nat. Definition tail_mul : nat -> nat -> nat. Definition of_uint_acc : Decimal.uint -> nat -> nat. Definition of_uint : Decimal.uint -> nat.
power_factor_lt_neq : forall p i j x y : nat, p <> 0 -> i < j -> ~ divides p x -> p ^ i * x <> p ^ j * y
divides_anti : forall x y : nat, divides x y -> divides y x -> x = y
prime_div_mult : forall p x y : nat, prime p -> divides p (x * y) -> divides p x \/ divides p y
divides_trans : forall x y z : nat, divides x y -> divides y z -> divides x z
own_multiple : forall x p : nat, x = p * x -> x = 0 \/ p = 1
BinInt.Z.le = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y <> Gt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.le (_ _)%Z_scope
prime_algo : forall p : nat, prime p < -> p = 2 \/ 3 <= p /\ ~ divides 2 p /\ (forall n : nat, 3 + 2 * n < p -> ~ divides (3 + 2 * n) p)
Init.Nat.div = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => fst (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.div (_ _)%nat_scope
BinInt.Z.lt = fun x y : BinNums.Z => BinInt.Z.compare x y = Lt : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> Prop Arguments BinInt.Z.lt (_ _)%Z_scope
Init.Nat.modulo = fun x y : nat => match y with | 0 => y | S y' => y' - snd (Init.Nat.divmod x y' 0 y') end : nat -> nat -> nat Arguments Init.Nat.modulo (_ _)%nat_scope
is_lcm = fun p q r : nat => divides p r /\ divides q r /\ (forall k : nat, divides p k -> divides q k -> divides r k) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_lcm (_ _ _)%nat_scope
is_gcd = fun p q r : nat => divides r p /\ divides r q /\ (forall k : nat, divides k p -> divides k q -> divides k r) : nat -> nat -> nat -> Prop Arguments is_gcd (_ _ _)%nat_scope
prime = fun p : nat => p <> 1 /\ (forall q : nat, divides q p -> q = 1 \/ q = p) : nat -> Prop Arguments prime _%nat_scope
measure_rect : forall (X : Type) (m : X -> nat) (P : X -> Type), (forall x : X, (forall y : X, m y < m x -> P y) -> P x) -> forall x : X, P x
div_rem_uniq : forall p n1 r1 n2 r2 : nat, p <> 0 -> n1 * p + r1 = n2 * p + r2 -> r1 < p -> r2 < p -> n1 = n2 /\ r1 = r2
prime_bool_rec_spec : forall n p : nat, n <= p -> prime_bool_rec n p = true < -> (forall k : nat, 3 <= n - 2 * k -> ~ divides (n - 2 * k) p)
divides_mult_inv : forall k p q : nat, k <> 0 -> divides (k * p) (k * q) -> divides p q
divides_0_inv : forall p : nat, divides 0 p -> p = 0
rem_plus_div : forall p : nat, p <> 0 -> forall a b : nat, divides p b -> rem a p = rem (a + b) p
divides_bool_spec' : forall n p : nat, divides_bool (S n) p = false < -> ~ divides (S n) p
Nat.mul_cancel_l : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> p * n = p * m < -> n = m
Nat.mul_cancel_r : forall n m p : nat, p <> 0 -> n * p = m * p < -> n = m
measure_rect2 : forall (X Y : Type) (m : X -> Y -> nat) (P : X -> Y -> Type), (forall (x : X) (y : Y), (forall (x' : X) (y' : Y), m x' y' < m x y -> P x' y') -> P x y) -> forall (x : X) (y : Y), P x y
is_gcd_mult_lcm : forall p q g l : nat, g <> 0 -> is_gcd p q g -> g * l = p * q -> is_lcm p q l
divides_div : forall q p : nat, divides p q -> q = div q p * p
mult_is_one : forall p q : nat, p * q = 1 -> p = 1 /\ q = 1
BinIntDef.Z.add = fun x y : BinNums.Z => match x with | BinNums.Z0 => y | BinNums.Zpos x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinNums.Zpos (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub x' y' end | BinNums.Zneg x' => match y with | BinNums.Z0 => x | BinNums.Zpos y' => BinIntDef.Z.pos_sub y' x' | BinNums.Zneg y' => BinNums.Zneg (BinPos.Pos.add x' y') end end : BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z -> BinNums.Z Arguments BinIntDef.Z.add (_ _)%Z_scope
bezout_sc : forall p q a b m : nat, a * p + b * q = 1 + m -> divides p m \/ divides q m -> is_gcd p q 1
divides_2_inv : forall p : nat, divides p 2 -> p = 1 \/ p = 2
is_gcd_0 : forall p q : nat, is_gcd p q 0 -> p = 0 /\ q = 0
